titleStmt.title: On King William's Success in Ireland.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: To Purchase kingdoms, and to Buy Renown, Are Arts peculiar to dissembling France:
You, Mighty Monarch, Nobler Actions Crown,And solid Virtue does Your Name advance.2
Your Matchless Courage with Your Prudence joins, The Glorious Structure of Your Fame to raise.
With its own Light Your dazling Glory shines,And into Adoration turns Your Praise.3
Had You by dull Succession gain'd Your Crown, (Cowards are Monarchs by that Title Made)
Part of Your Merit Chance wou'd call her Own,And half Your Virtues had been lost in Shade.4
But now Your Worth its just Reward shall have; What Trophies, and what Triumphs are yr due!
Who coud so Well a dying Nation save,At once deserve a Crown, and gain it too.5
You saw how near We Were to Ruin brought, You saw the Impetuous Torrent rolling on;
And timely on the comeing danger thought,Which We cou'd Neither Obviate nor shun.6
Britannia stript from her sole Guard the Laws, Ready to fall Rome's bloody sacrifice;
You strait stept in, and from the Monster's Jaws,Did bravely snatch the Lovely helples Prize.7
Nor is this all: as Glorious is the Care To Preserve Conquests, as at first to gain:
In this Your Virtue claims a double share,Which, what it bravely Won, do's well Maintain.8
Your Arm has now Yr Rightful Title show'd,An Arm, on which all Europe's hopes depend,
To which They Look as to some Guardian God,That must their doubtful Liberty defend.9
Amaz'd thy Actions at the Boyne we see!When Schonberg started at the Vast Design;
The Boundless Glory all redounds to Thee,Th'Impulse, The Fight, th'Event, were wholy Thine.10
The Brave Attempt do's all Our Foes disarm, You need but now Give Orders and Comand;
Your Name shall the remaining Work performAnd spare the Labour of Your Conqu'ring Hand.11
France does in Vain her feeble Arts apply, To Interrupt the Fortune of Your Course:
Your Influence do's the Vain Attacks defyeOf secret Malice, or of open force.12
Boldly we hence the brave CommencetÌ£ date,Of glorious Deeds that must all Tongues Employ:William's the Pledge & Earnest given by FateOf England's Glory, and her Lasting Ioy.011-002D
